glsa.title: Smb4K: Arbitrary command execution as root
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Smb4K could allow local attackers to execute commands as root.

background.p: Smb4K is a SMB/CIFS (Windows) share browser for KDE.

description.p: Smb4k contains a logic flaw in which mount helper binary does not properly verify the mount command it is being asked to run.

impact.p: A local user can execute commands with the root privilege due to the mount helper being installed as suid.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Smb4K users should upgrade to the latest version:
